findings.title: Frozen and active token balance desynchronization
findings.description: The destroy method doesn’t destroy frozen_balance, which can lead to complex issues.

findings.title: Lack of access separation
findings.description: The meltTokens function has onlyOwner access modifier but it's used by a separate melting service, which is not necessary and may lead to greater exposure if the service is compromised.

findings.title: Wrong modifiers usage
findings.description: The onlyWhitelisted modifier is used incorrectly.

findings.title: Require Check Typo
findings.description: Duplicate require from present when it should be: require (to != address ( 0 ), “ERC20: transfer to the zero address” )

findings.title: Expensive token migration
findings.description: According to current architecture, KICKICO team will take a snapshot of old KICKICO token holders and propagate their balances to the new token. Since there are 18.5k addresses in there, it’s going to cost 6-16 ETH on average.

findings.title: Risky implementation of changeOwner functionality
findings.description: Current changeOwner implementation does not validate newOwner.

findings.title: Transfer event usage for mint and burn operations
findings.description: The contract should emit Transfer event from and to address(0) respectively during mint and burn operations.

findings.title: The approveAndCall feature
findings.description: The current version does not have a way to send tokens to a smart contract and trigger some functionality of it.

findings.title: pauseTrigger and burnTrigger methods simplification
findings.description: The token contract has functionality that stops and starts token transfer and destruction. These methods can be optimized to better the interface.

findings.title: Frozen token storage issue
findings.description: In the current implementation, _frozen_balanceOf shows how many tokens of the total user balance are frozen, which requires to change _balances mapping in all of the methods that work with frozen tokens.

findings.title: Lack of the Transfer event for the _mintfrozen method
findings.description: The _mintfrozen method emits a Transfer event with incorrect arguments, missing the event to indicate that freezing took place.

findings.title: Redundant require check
findings.description: The redundant require check can cause SafeMath overflow exception.

findings.title: The approveAndCall method does not validate spender contract
findings.description: The second version of the token contract has ApproveAndCall, but it does not validate the boolean value that spender contract returns.

findings.title: The accountBalance and _frozen_balanceOf methods obfuscate useful information
findings.description: Users should be able to see the frozen amount of their tokens. Otherwise, they are unable to properly consider the amount of active tokens.

findings.title: Unused functionality
findings.description: These methods are not used anywhere.

findings.title: Lack of access separation
findings.description: The meltTokens function has onlyOwner access modifier but it's used by a separate melting service, which may cause greater exposure if the service is compromised.

findings.title: Wrong modifiers usage
findings.description: The onlyWhitelisted modifier is used incorrectly.
